Let me think about the best hand to play:


Playing the pair of 10s gives me 25 base chips plus 3 mult, with the Blue Joker adding 88 chips from remaining deck cards. That's 133 × 3 = 399 total—nowhere near the 1200 needed. I need to explore other combinations that might leverage the Smiley Face joker's multiplier bonus from face cards.

If I include the Queen and Jack alongside the pair of 10s, I get the same 133 chips since only cards in the scoring hand contribute their chip values. The key question is whether the Smiley Face joker multiplies the score when face cards are played, even if they're not part of the pair itself.

Looking at the rules more carefully: cards that don't participate in the hand don't trigger effects. Since the Queen and Jack wouldn't be part of the pair, they wouldn't score and therefore wouldn't activate Smiley Face's bonus. The multiplier only applies to face cards that actually score as part of the hand.

But that 585-chip result suggests something else is happening. Let me reconsider whether non-participating cards might still trigger "on scored" effects differently than "when played" effects, or if there's another mechanic at play here that's boosting the score significantly.

For the immediate decision, I should focus on the clearest option: playing exactly 4 cards with the pair of 10s and two other cards would trigger Square Joker for a permanent +4 chips boost, giving me 137 base chips with 3x multiplier.

The flush would likely generate better scoring than my current options. Base mult: 4

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

Expected: 121 × 13 = 1,573 chips

But I only got 363 chips. The issue is likely that Smiley Face didn't activate because the face cards weren't counted as "scored" within the pair itself—only the base pair and number cards contributed to the chip total, then multiplied by just the base 3 mult: 121 × 3 = 363 chips.

Cards not actively participating in the hand don't trigger their effects.
